instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..
definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.R7050: What is R7050? Current sense shunt resistor for the battery, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 17/18 on ISL6259 should give you 2.02 ohms. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - 2351: No start
threads.message:
Hello,
I have a MacBook Pro 13.3 "early 2010, <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, EMC 2351, SN WQ031BPZATM, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.
He does not want to light up anymore because of the water spilled on the keyboard.
Green LED of the charger that turns on, but nothing, black screen, no noise, no fan.
No visual damage on the motherboard.
Nothing that heats up abnormally.
I suspect <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7035</TRANSISTOR> but not sure, how to test them?
Cordially.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - 2351: No start
threads.message:
Disconnect keyboard and use <RESISTOR>R5014</RESISTOR>/15 pads, instead of power button.
Post exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage; keep battery removed.
Also check L7750 voltage and RTC signals.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - 2351: No start
threads.message:
I had already tried to boot the motherboard without the keyboard with <RESISTOR>R5014</RESISTOR> / 15 but nothing.
For PPBUS-G3H, without the battery, the voltage fluctuates between 10 / 9V up to 3.3 / 2V.
For the RTC signal, how do I test it, I test the voltage of <SIGNAL>RTC_RST_L</SIGNAL>, RTC_CLK32KXTALIN, RTC_CLK32KXTALOUT and RTC_CLK32KXTALOUT_R?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - 2351: No start
threads.message:
You must first get correct and steady <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage.
Remove F7040 and check voltage at L7030.
Post exact resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - 2351: No start
threads.message:
On L7750 I have 0V.
F7740 is OK, beep on both sides.
On L7030, without F7040, I also have a voltage that fluctuates between 4 and 2 V approximately.
No resistance between <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> pins 17/18 and 27/28.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - 2351: No start
threads.message:
"No resistance between <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> pins 17/18 and 27/28."
Are you sure???
Fix the problem; check schematic and replace corroded resistors.
Also check traces continuity.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - 2351: No start
threads.message:
I have 0 ohm.
The tracks are OK, I send pictures of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - 2351: No start
threads.message:
"No resistance between <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> pins 17/18 and 27/28
----------------------
I have 0 ohm"
Can you specify???
Please check schematic.

"The tracks are OK"
Did you check traces to <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>/21/22 and <RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR>/51/52?
